channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Robert Redford says he worked at Yosemite National Park before making it in Hollywood, inspired by his first visit when he had ‘a mild case of polio’
item.description: Redford grew up to be a Hollywood icon, but his love of nature proved to play a big role in his career and legacy.

item.title: Tim Cook says Apple’s $600 billion factory build out will create a ‘domino effect.’ But the tech giant still isn’t building iPhones in America
item.description: A manufacturer labor shortage and an “impossible-to-replicate” supply chain will keep the tech giant dependent on Asia factories, experts tell Fortune...

item.title: Trump’s Second U.K. State Visit Draws Protests
item.description: As President Trump arrived in Britain on Tuesday night, protesters unveiled visual stunts aimed at highlighting his ties to Jeffrey Epstein, while a m...

item.title: How Nepal’s Government Went Up in Smoke
item.description: Arson attacks during protests in Nepal destroyed buildings, court files and even records of international agreements and state investments.

item.title: Trump is pushing for a ‘big cut’ from the Fed today—but he’s already on a losing streak
item.description: Trump failed to oust Fed Governor Lisa Cook and is unlikely to get the steep rate cut he demands, as Powell and the FOMC weigh weaker jobs data.

item.title: Jerry of Ben & Jerry’s Resigns, Saying Company Has Been ‘Silenced’
item.description: Jerry Greenfield said that the ice cream company, known for its activism, had been muzzled by Unilever, its parent company.

item.title: 1 in 3 Americans have no emergency savings—while boomers’ $2,000 cushion dwarfs Gen Z’s $400, survey finds
item.description: Roughly one-third of Americans are not prepared for a financial emergency.

item.title: The economy is reliant on the ‘fortunes of the well-to-do’ says Moody’s—if the ultra-rich get nervy that means recession
item.description: Mark Zandi says of the rich: "If they turn more cautious, for whatever reason, the economy has a big problem."

item.title: Trump’s New Plan to Target Liberal Groups, and a Shouting Match in the Senate
Driver Crashes Car Into F.B.I. Field Office Gate in Pittsburgh
item.description: A driver rammed into the entrance of the compound and fled on foot in what officials believed to be a targeted act. Officials named a suspect.

item.title: Quiz on U.K. State Visit Etiquette as Trump Meets With Charles
item.description: If you were an aide to President Trump during his trip to Britain and wanted to avoid any pitfalls, what would you do?

item.title: President Trump’s 2nd U.K. State Visit: What’s on the Agenda
item.description: The president and the first lady will be hosted at Windsor Castle by King Charles III and Queen Camilla.

item.title: Security plans for Trump’s visit are the biggest since the coronation of King Charles III.
Live Updates: U.K. Prepares Royal Welcome for Trump in 2nd State Visit
item.description: With a carriage ride at Windsor Castle and dinner with King Charles III, Britain tries to appeal to a president who has seemed intent on upending the ...

item.title: How Nepal’s Government Went Up in Smoke
item.description: Arson attacks during protests in Nepal destroyed buildings, court files and even records of international agreements and state investments.
